alert.note: Alert for Carquinez Strait and Delta; Northern San Joaquin Valley; Southern Sacramento Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Watch issued December 26 at 4:27AM PST until December 28 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Several Very Cold Nights Ahead for Interior Northern California... .A cold weather pattern is forecast to bring several very cold nights and early mornings to interior Northern California this week. Low temperatures are forecast to drop below freezing in urban areas and plummet into the 20s in rural areas including the lower foothills. Although this stretch of cold weather is expected to result in low temperatures from 5 to 12 degrees below normal, widespread record low temperatures are not expected. This stretch of cold weather occurs roughly once every 5 to 10 years this time of year. ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Below freezing temperatures dropping into the upper 20s outside the cities and as low as 30 within the city limits. * WHERE...Southern Sacramento Valley, Carquinez Strait and Delta and Northern San Joaquin Valley Counties. * WHEN...From late Monday evening through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. Remember to bring pets indoors during the overnight hours.

area.areaDesc: Carquinez Strait and Delta; Northern San Joaquin Valley; Southern Sacramento Valley
